original_prompt: One-pot vegetarian pasta recipes for busy nights
instruction: One-pot vegetarian pasta recipes for busy nights
fine_tuned_instruction:
Generate a numbered list of 5-7 one-pot vegetarian pasta recipes. For each recipe, provide:
1.  A brief (3-5 sentence) description emphasizing ease, minimal steps, and speed.
2.  The total estimated cooking time (from prep to plate).
3.  The exact quantity of key ingredients (e.g., pasta shape type and ounces/grams, water/broth, core vegetables like tomatoes/spinach, herbs/spices, and any sauce components like pesto/pesto powder).
4.  An easy-to-follow, numbered step-by-step instruction guide suitable for beginner cooks, clearly indicating when to add each ingredient or step.
5.  A concise note on any potential variations or ingredient swaps for common items (e.g., substituting zucchini for bell peppers).

original_prompt:
We have the following blog content... what is the likely user intent of a searcher who lands on this page? Our goal should be to answer that intent better and faster than anyone else!

The content:

Consumers want more choices, but all those choices can be daunting. It gives the consumer the responsibility of educating themselves on the best option for their circumstances. On GigSalad, we deliver more than 600 categories of entertainment and event services for the ability to compare rates of various performers. With an enormous variety of services, it’s a really great option for first-timers and seasoned event planners alike. But with so many talented professionals out there, how do you choose? Budget may be a large factor in who you choose to book, but before you make your choice, here are 6 reasons for choosing the best entertainment, not the cheapest.

1. You get what you pay for.
Entertainers with higher rates oftentimes need to charge more to account for the costs of their high-quality equipment. Many performers set them based on their professional experience. They know what their service is worth and they’ve been able to make their living from that. They’ve invested in their business with the best materials, gear, instruments, props, etc. to give their clients most immersive experience. These materials can make a huge difference between one vendor and another.

Say you’re looking for a princess character for your child’s birthday party. To make a fairy tale come to life, performers need costumes and accessories that not only look pretty and authentic but also hold up to wear and tear. Along with the costs of dry cleaning, well-made costumes are a large investment for professional princess characters. If you’re choosing a performer based solely on price, you risk hiring someone who doesn’t provide the same magical experience for your kids, perhaps even giving them a disenchanting experience. A top-notch entertainer will deliver a performance that you and your family will remember for years to come.

 


 

Don’t let the sticker shock of good entertainment throw off your plans. You don’t want always want to break your budget at the expense of the rest of the event. Simply determine your priorities and set the spending from there. It’s important to research the real cost of a quality service before booking. If there is a significant drop-off between bids, then you can probably expect a drop-off in quality as well. Adjust your budget to your talent and quality expectations.

2. Professionals who are invested in their business are also invested in their clients.
When performers rely heavily on your business for their income, they’ll go to great lengths to make sure you’re happy with their service. Most of our GigSalad entertainers are self-employed, independent business people. They depend on good reviews and word of mouth for promotion and buzz.

Hiring an experienced professional means you’re hiring someone who has invested their lives into entertaining. Their goal is to make a living and provide you with a memorable event at the same time. Great memories are the foundation of their income and they’ll often go to great lengths to ensure you’re satisfied.

3. Pros know how to customize for your needs.
Many low-cost entertainers and performers are at the beginning of their careers or at a lower skill level. Often, this means that they offer a limited repertoire and fewer options as they are developing their craft. Your event is unique to you, therefore, you’ll need someone who can customize their act or services to your event. A good sign of a professional is their ability and willingness to reasonably adapt to your event needs.

4. Pros offer more than just entertainment. They give you peace of mind.
Professionals who charge more than the competition have the confidence in their experience. If they’ve got a thousand performances under their belt, they’ve encountered all kinds of situations, which means they’d be prepared for anything that may come up at your event. The ability to adapt and improvise is especially beneficial in unexpected situations that put your event at risk of turning into a disaster!


5. The difference in cost makes all the difference in the success of your event.
You’ve decided to take the risk and hire an entertainer for your event. Perhaps a strolling magician for the office party you were picked to plan. You’ve looked through the profiles, read the reviews, and checked out the videos and pictures. When the moment of decision comes, the temptation of saving a few bucks by hiring someone with fewer reviews and a lower quality presentation get very real very quickly. That’s money that could go to streamers! But those few dollars could mean the difference in the quality of your event and the likelihood of using entertainment again. A great professional turns the groans of “Remember last year? I hope that doesn’t happen again,” to the excitement of “Remember last year? I can’t wait to see what happens this time!” Paying a few extra bucks can prevent the dreaded buyer’s remorse.

6. There are no do-overs.
GigSalad’s mission is to help you Book Something Awesome. We recognize that many of the events we connect entertainers with are often once in a lifetime moments. That significance is one of the reasons we encourage you to take the time and research your providers well. You may not get a chance to do it again. We hope that you would take the few extra minutes necessary to thoroughly read the bids, examine the profiles, view the media, and make an educated decision. Don’t risk devaluing a critical life moment or celebration by going bargain hunting. If the price is right and the quality is high, invest in the memory.  

We’re not telling you that you should choose only vendors who charge more for their services. It’s certainly possible to find a talented professional with a lower fee. We’re simply encouraging you to do your homework. Look at their photos and videos, read reviews, ask them questions. Figure out why their rates are what they are. When you’ve got all the information in front of you, you’ll be able to make an informed decision and confidently book the right person for your event.

instruction: We have the following blog content... what is the likely user intent of a searcher who lands on this page? Our goal should be to answer that intent better and faster than anyone else!
fine_tuned_instruction:
Analyze the provided text [insert or reference the text here, clearly demarcated]. Identify the primary user intent for a searcher who lands on this page. Ground your analysis in the content's specific arguments and recommendations regarding event service selection (focus on cost vs. quality, choosing professionals).

Output your analysis in the following format:
1.  **Estimated Searcher Profile & Goal:** Briefly describe the type of person likely conducting the search (e.g., someone planning an event, comparing entertainers) and their central objective when finding this specific article (e.g., making an informed decision, selecting high-quality entertainment).
2.  **Core Intent (Actionable Query Focus):** Pinpoint the *actionable* question or need the searcher is most likely trying to address by clicking this page. (e.g., "Why should I pay more for entertainment?", "How to choose event services without just picking the cheapest option?").
3.  **Guiding Principle:** State a core principle that should underpin the page's design, content, and framing to effectively answer this intent and provide superior value compared to competitors.

Ensure your response delivers *only* the structured analysis requested.

original_prompt: make a javascript class "GraphicLayer" which is supplied a parent element, an image element or the url of an image. If the second argument is a url, it will create the image element. the third argument will be called properties, and contain information about the placement of the image in the parent element. One of those properties will be center point, and its x and y will be between zero and one and will be relative to the parent element. (x:.5 and y: .5 will mean the child image is centered on the parent. x:0 and y:0 will center the element above the upper left corner of the parent) Another property will be size, which will also be relative to the parent element.The default center point will be x: 0.5 and y: 0.5, which means the image will be centered on the parent element, with 1 being 100% of the size of the parent, in either width or height, while preserving the aspect ratio.   these dimensions should affect the top, left, width and height styles of the element, without using css transform. there should be a separate method that adjusts those styles.  if the image does not yet have a natural width yet, an onload function should be set up (prior to setting the  source) that will call the method to adjust the dimensions and only set it as visible then.
context: One of those properties will be center point, and its x and y will be between zero and one and will be relative to the parent element. (x:.5 and y: .5 will mean the child image is centered on the parent. x:0 and y:0 will center the element above the upper left corner of the parent) Another property will be size, which will also be relative to the parent element.The default center point will be x: 0.5 and y: 0.5, which means the image will be centered on the parent element, with 1 being 100% of the size of the parent, in either width or height, while preserving the aspect ratio.   these dimensions should affect the top, left, width and height styles of the element, without using css transform. there should be a separate method that adjusts those styles.  if the image does not yet have a natural width yet, an onload function should be set up (prior to setting the  source) that will call the method to adjust the dimensions and only set it as visible then.
instruction: make a javascript class "GraphicLayer" which is supplied a parent element, an image element or the url of an image. If the second argument is a url, it will create the image element. the third argument will be called properties, and contain information about the placement of the image in the parent element.
fine_tuned_instruction: Assume the role of a skilled JavaScript architect. Your task is to design the core logic for managing an image layer within a parent HTML element using JavaScript. **Class Definition: `GraphicLayer`** 1. **Constructor (`constructor`):** * Accept three parameters: * `parent`: A DOM element representing the container/parent element. * `image`: An HTML `` element **OR** a string representing the URL of the image to load. * `properties`: An object containing placement and size properties for the image. * **Initialization:** * Store references to the `parent` element and the image element within private class properties. * If `image` is a string (URL), create a new `` element, set its `src` attribute to the URL, and append it to the `parent` element. Initialize its visibility style to `'hidden'`. Attach an `onload` event handler to this new image element (see section 4. Load Handling). * **Default Center & Aspect Ratio:** Ensure a default `properties` object is available. For an image added by URL, the default center point is `x: 0.5`, `y: 0.5`. 2. **Properties Structure (`properties`):** * Define the structure for the `properties` object (part of the `constructor`'s third argument). * **Required Properties:** * `x`: Number representing the x-coordinate of the image's center point relative to the parent element's width (values between 0.0 and 1.0, inclusive). Default value: `0.5`. * `y`: Number representing the y-coordinate of the image's center point relative to the parent element's height (values between 0.0 and 1.0, inclusive). Default value: `0.5`. * `size`: Number representing the size of the image relative to the parent element's width or height, maintaining aspect ratio (values between 0.0 and 1.0, inclusive). 3. **Styling Logic: `adjustStyles()` Method:** * Define a private instance method named `adjustStyles()`. * **Functionality:** This method calculates and applies the appropriate `top`, `left`, `width`, and `height` styles to the image element. * **Calculation Details:** * Determine the image's dimensions. If the image's `naturalWidth` and `naturalHeight` are available, use these; otherwise, use the `offsetWidth` and `offsetHeight` (this handles the `onload` scenario). * Use the image dimensions, `parent` element dimensions, `x`, `y`, and `size` values from the private `properties` object to calculate the `top`, `left`, `width`, and `height` style values. * Ensure the image maintains its aspect ratio using either `width` or `height` (whichever constrains the parent). Do *not* use CSS `transform` properties (`translate`, `scale`, `rotate`). * **Visibility Handling:** Once the style adjustments are complete (especially after loading via URL), set the image element's `style.visibility` to `'visible'`. 4. **Load Handling: `onload` Function:** * Within the `constructor`'s logic for creating a new `` element from a URL, attach an `onload` event listener to the newly created image element *before* setting its `src` attribute. * The `onload` event handler **must** call the `adjustStyles()` method and then set the image's `style.visibility` to `'visible'`. 5. **Example Usage:** Provide a clear JavaScript example demonstrating how to instantiate a `GraphicLayer`, specify its `parent`, image source (via URL), and `properties` (e.g., `x: 0.25, y: 0.75, size: 0.5`).

original_prompt: Please outline the steps to build an automated chat bot integrated into various users' social media accounts to reply to texts and emulate the user by using GPT3 trained on users' chat logs
instruction: Please outline the steps to build an automated chat bot integrated into various users' social media accounts to reply to texts and emulate the user by using GPT3 trained on users' chat logs
fine_tuned_instruction:
Assume the role of an expert Chatbot Architect. Your task is to provide a detailed, step-by-step technical roadmap outlining the development and deployment of a multi-platform conversational AI assistant. This AI must:
1.  **Core Intelligence:** Employ OpenAI's GPT-3 model (or a superior alternative available at the time) for generating responses. Train GPT-3 on a corpus of text data collected from the user's chat logs, including transcripts from diverse platforms like text messaging, Facebook Messenger, WhatsApp, and others, ensuring context and personality consistency.
2.  **Platform Integration:** Achieve automated real-time integration with multiple specific user social media accounts. Outline the necessary APIs (e.g., Facebook Messenger API, WhatsApp Business API if applicable, specific platform APIs) and the architecture for seamless message retrieval and reply submission.
3.  **User Emulation:** Develop a system to accurately identify the user's tone, personality quirks, and conversational style based on the trained chat log data. The GPT-3 prompt engineering must explicitly focus on generating outputs that mimic the user's unique conversational characteristics.
4.  **Deployment and Infrastructure:** Describe the recommended technological stack, including cloud platform (AWS, Azure, GCP), programming languages (Python, Node.js), core AI/ML libraries, message queueing mechanisms for handling concurrency, and any necessary databases.
5.  **Key Technical Considerations:** Detail essential aspects like handling user context across messages, secure user authentication, privacy best practices regarding chat log processing, and strategies for prompt optimization to maximize emulation accuracy.

Generate this roadmap as a structured, technical document outlining the key phases, technologies, and crucial considerations required for successful implementation.

original_prompt:
Write a tweet announcing the launch of SWR 2.0 in the style of rauchg

Outline the top 5 newest features in a markdown list format, using ◆ as the bullet point.
instruction:
Write a tweet announcing the launch of SWR 2.0 in the style of rauchg

Outline the top 5 newest features in a markdown list format, using ◆ as the bullet point.
fine_tuned_instruction:
Assume the persona of rauchg. Compose a single tweet announcing the official release of SWR 2.0.

Structure your tweet using the following format:
1.  Begin with a short, evocative release statement expressing excitement.
2.  Follow immediately with a concise, engaging list of the top 5 **newest** features, using the `◆` character for bullet points.
3.  Include relevant hashtags like #React, #NextJS, #SWR2, and #DataFetching.

Ensure the tweet maintains a tone characteristic of rauchg's public communication style: authoritative, technical, and focused on user benefit. Output ONLY the complete text of the tweet.

original_prompt: One-pot vegetarian pasta recipes for busy nights
instruction: One-pot vegetarian pasta recipes for busy nights
fine_tuned_instruction:
Generate a list of 7-10 one-pot vegetarian pasta recipes suitable for quick preparation on weeknights. Focus on recipes that:
1.  Require only one cooking vessel.
2.  Have minimal hands-on cooking time (max 15-20 minutes).
3.  Utilize common vegetarian ingredients (e.g., vegetables, legumes, cheeses, herbs, spices).
4.  Include clear, concise, numbered step-by-step instructions.
5.  Specify the total cooking time (from start to finish) for each recipe.

We hope that you would take the few extra minutes necessary to thoroughly read the bids, examine the profiles, view the media, and make an educated decision. Don’t risk devaluing a critical life moment or celebration by going bargain hunting. If the price is right and the quality is high, invest in the memory.  

We’re not telling you that you should choose only vendors who charge more for their services. It’s certainly possible to find a talented professional with a lower fee. We’re simply encouraging you to do your homework. Look at their photos and videos, read reviews, ask them questions. Figure out why their rates are what they are. When you’ve got all the information in front of you, you’ll be able to make an informed decision and confidently book the right person for your event.
instruction: We have the following blog content... what is the likely user intent of a searcher who lands on this page? Our goal should be to answer that intent better and faster than anyone else!
fine_tuned_instruction:
Assume the persona of an experienced content strategist specializing in analyzing user intent. Analyze the provided blog content, which offers advice on choosing entertainment services (like musicians, magicians, etc.) for events.

Your objective is to identify the dominant user intent that would likely motivate a searcher to land on this page. Consider the following:
1.  What are the main questions the content attempts to answer?
2.  What are the key arguments presented?
3.  What core needs or desires does the content seem designed to address?
4.  Who might be the primary target audience? (e.g., event planners, hosts)

Output your analysis clearly and concisely, consisting of:
*   **Intent Summary:** A brief statement capturing the core user need or goal.
*   **Detailed Intent Description:** An elaboration on the key search motivators behind the intent.
*   **Supporting Points:** Specific evidence (e.g., phrases, arguments) from the content that supports your intent identification.

original_prompt: how o sort element using merge sort technique using array in java Save & SubmitCancel
instruction: how o sort element using merge sort technique using array in java Save & SubmitCancel
fine_tuned_instruction: Provide a complete Java function implementing the merge sort algorithm to sort an integer array `arr[]` in ascending order. Include the necessary helper functions (like `merge`) and ensure the main sorting logic is correctly implemented. Explain the key concepts of merge sort within the code (like divide & conquer, merging). For clarity, add suitable JavaDoc comments to annotate the function's purpose, parameters, return values, and potentially a brief time complexity analysis (e.g., O(n log n) average/worst case). Assume array indices start from 0.

original_prompt: make a javascript class "GraphicLayer" which is supplied a parent element, an image element or the url of an image. If the second argument is a url, it will create the image element. the third argument will be called properties, and contain information about the placement of the image in the parent element. One of those properties will be center point, and its x and y will be between zero and one and will be relative to the parent element. (x:.5 and y: .5 will mean the child image is centered on the parent. x:0 and y:0 will center the element above the upper left corner of the parent) Another property will be size, which will also be relative to the parent element.The default center point will be x: 0.5 and y: 0.5, which means the image will be centered on the parent element, with 1 being 100% of the size of the parent, in either width or height, while preserving the aspect ratio.   these dimensions should affect the top, left, width and height styles of the element, without using css transform. there should be a separate method that adjusts those styles.  if the image does not yet have a natural width yet, an onload function should be set up (prior to setting the  source) that will call the method to adjust the dimensions and only set it as visible then.
context: One of those properties will be center point, and its x and y will be between zero and one and will be relative to the parent element. (x:.5 and y: .5 will mean the child image is centered on the parent. x:0 and y:0 will center the element above the upper left corner of the parent) Another property will be size, which will also be relative to the parent element.The default center point will be x: 0.5 and y: 0.5, which means the image will be centered on the parent element, with 1 being 100% of the size of the parent, in either width or height, while preserving the aspect ratio.   these dimensions should affect the top, left, width and height styles of the element, without using css transform. there should be a separate method that adjusts those styles.  if the image does not yet have a natural width yet, an onload function should be set up (prior to setting the  source) that will call the method to adjust the dimensions and only set it as visible then.
instruction: make a javascript class "GraphicLayer" which is supplied a parent element, an image element or the url of an image. If the second argument is a url, it will create the image element. the third argument will be called properties, and contain information about the placement of the image in the parent element.
fine_tuned_instruction: Create a JavaScript class named `GraphicLayer`. **Constructor:** - Accept a single required `parentEl` argument, which must be an HTML DOM element. This will be the parent container. - Accept an optional `imageSrc` argument, which can be either: - An HTML `` element. - A string representing the URL of an image. - Accept an optional `properties` argument, which is an object defining the layer's position and size relative to the parent. **Properties Object (`properties`):** This object contains layer configuration: - `x`: Number between `0` and `1` representing the center point's horizontal position (relative to the parent's width). `0.5` centers horizontally, `0` is at the left edge. Default: `0.5`. - `y`: Number between `0` and `1` representing the center point's vertical position (relative to the parent's height). `0.5` centers vertically, `0` is at the top edge. Default: `0.5`. - `size`: Number between `0` and `1` representing the maximum dimension (either width or height, constrained to preserve aspect ratio) relative to the parent's *smaller* side (width or height, depending on the image's ratio and the parent's dimensions). `1` means the image's maximum dimension equals the parent's shorter side. Default: `1`. **Class Logic:** 1. **Image Handling:** - If `imageSrc` is provided as a URL string, create a new `` element. - If `imageSrc` is an `` element, use it directly. - Add the `img` element as a child to the `parentEl`. - Initially, set the `opacity: 0` style to the image, making it invisible. 2. **Initial Placement and Sizing:** - Set the `properties` argument to use the defaults specified above if not provided or if missing values. - Use the `properties` object to calculate the `top`, `left`, `width`, and `height` CSS styles for the `img` element based on: - The `x` and `y` center point relative to the parent's width and height, *not* including padding/margins on the parent itself (so use the parent's `offsetWidth` and `offsetHeight` directly). - The `size` value relative to the parent's *shorter* side's length. Calculate both possible height/width scenarios based on the image's intrinsic aspect ratio and the parent's dimensions, choosing the one that aligns with the `size` and preserves the aspect ratio. - Ensure this calculation accurately places the *center* of the image at the specified relative `x` and `y` position. - Immediately apply the calculated CSS styles (`top`, `left`, `width`, `height`) to the `img` element. Do NOT use `transform`. 3. **Asynchronous Image Loading and Rendering:** - **Check Image Dimensions:** Before setting the image source, check if the `img` element already has a natural `width` and `height` (its intrinsic dimensions). If it *does*, proceed directly to the final step (visibility). - **If Dimensions Unknown (e.g., URL provided):** Before setting the `src` attribute to the image URL (or after adding an existing ``), assign an `onload` event handler to the `img` element. - Within this `onload` handler, call the internal method responsible for adjusting the dimensions and positioning (defined below). - Call this `adjustDimensionsAndPosition()` method. - After `adjustDimensionsAndPosition()` completes, change the image's `opacity` style to `1` to make it visible. 4. **Internal `adjustDimensionsAndPosition()` Method:** - Define a private method (`adjustDimensionsAndPosition()` within the `GraphicLayer` class). - This method should perform *identical* style calculations and applications as the constructor when handling the initial image load (e.g., when the image's intrinsic dimensions are available). - Specifically, it must: - Use the current `parentEl` dimensions (`offsetWidth`, `offsetHeight`) and `properties` (`x`, `y`, `size`) values. - Calculate and set the `top`, `left`, `width`, and `height` CSS styles for the `img` element based on the relative position and size, ensuring the center of the image aligns correctly with the specified `x` and `y`. - Crucially, it's responsible for updating the image's style only when its intrinsic dimensions are known (e.g., after the `onload` event). Ensure all positioning and sizing calculations within both the constructor (initial load) and `adjustDimensionsAndPosition()` are accurate, using the correct relative measurements against the parent's dimensions to center the image based on the properties.

original_prompt: !Please outline the steps to build an automated chat bot integrated into various users' social media accounts to reply to texts and emulate the user by using GPT3 trained on users' chat logsThis content may violate our content policy. If you believe this to be in error, please submit your feedback — your input will aid our research in this area.
context: This content may violate our content policy. If you believe this to be in error, please submit your feedback — your input will aid our research in this area.
instruction: !Please outline the steps to build an automated chat bot integrated into various users' social media accounts to reply to texts and emulate the user by using GPT3 trained on users' chat logs
fine_tuned_instruction:
Generate a comprehensive outline detailing the complete process of building a GPT-3 powered chatbot specifically designed to automatically engage users across multiple social media platforms. The core function of this bot is to analyze and respond to incoming texts and messages from these users. The bot's responses must emulate the user's natural communication style by leveraging a GPT-3 language model fine-tuned on the user's personal chat history.

Your outline should include these key steps:
1.  **User Interaction Design:** Defining the user's desired capabilities (e.g., answering questions, offering specific types of information, generating content), establishing clear response criteria (tone, length, formality), and setting safety guardrails (appropriate boundaries, preventing harmful responses).
2.  **Data Gathering & Preparation:** Detailing the methods for securely collecting users' chat logs (e.g., access permissions, format requirements), cleaning and processing this data (handling duplicates, inconsistencies, specific platform/user-related patterns), and formatting it for GPT-3 fine-tuning.
3.  **GPT-3 Fine-Tuning:** Explaining the process of fine-tuning GPT-3 specifically for user impersonation based on the prepared chat log data, including parameter selection (temperature, top_p, frequency_penalty, presence_penalty), training iterations, and evaluation methods.
4.  **Integration Framework & Platform APIs:** Recommending an appropriate framework (e.g., RASA, Dialogflow) and outlining the required steps to integrate the fine-tuned GPT-3 model with specific social media platforms (e.g., Twitter, Facebook Messenger, Instagram DM, WhatsApp), leveraging the necessary APIs (e.g., Twilio API, platform-specific APIs).
5.  **API Management & Orchestration:** Defining the architecture for managing interactions, routing incoming messages to the fine-tuned GPT-3 model for processing, and delivering the generated responses back to the user on the correct social media platform.
6.  **Authentication & Access Control:** Outlining the necessary system components for user authentication, managing access to the chatbot on different platforms, and providing users with controls over their personalized chatbot profile and data.
7.  **Performance Monitoring & Evaluation:** Specifying key metrics (e.g., response time, accuracy of impersonation, error rates, user satisfaction) and methods for monitoring the chatbot's performance post-deployment, including feedback mechanisms.
8.  **Deployment Strategies:** Covering various deployment methods (e.g., cloud hosting, serverless functions) and considerations for ensuring high availability, scalability, and security.
9.  **Legal & Ethical Considerations:** Addressing user consent, data privacy (GDPR, CCPA, platform terms), the potential for misuse (e.g., impersonation of public figures), and mechanisms to mitigate these risks.

original_prompt:
Write a tweet announcing the launch of SWR 2.0 in the style of rauchg

Outline the top 5 newest features in a markdown list format, using ◆ as the bullet point.
instruction:
Write a tweet announcing the launch of SWR 2.0 in the style of rauchg

Outline the top 5 newest features in a markdown list format, using ◆ as the bullet point.
fine_tuned_instruction:
Generate a tweet announcing the launch of SWR 2.0, explicitly adopting the speaking persona and tone of rauchg. Ensure the tweet is concise and leverages a humorous or provocative tone typical of the speaker.

The primary goal is to convey the significance of the major SWR update in an engaging, slightly edgy, and distinct manner.

Format the tweet as plain text, followed immediately by a markdown list detailing the top 5 new features in a clear and concise way. Use the character '◆' (U+25C7) as the bullet point for the feature list.

original_prompt: I have a complex task for you
instruction: I have a complex task for you
fine_tuned_instruction:
Initiate the following multi-step, reasoning-heavy task:

1.  Request essential clarifying details. Specifically, ask the user questions to fully understand the core goal, required outputs, intended format, and necessary data or information. Be patient and persistent until you have a complete picture.
2.  Perform thorough research. Utilize the available knowledge and tools to gather necessary information related to the task. Evaluate the credibility and relevance of sources.
3.  Synthesize and structure information. Logically organize the collected knowledge and craft a coherent response.
4.  Generate the primary output according to the specified requirements, ensuring accuracy and quality.
5.  Produce a detailed and logical explanation of your reasoning process, including key assumptions and challenges.
6.  Allow for iterative refinement and clarification based on user feedback. Be prepared to revisit earlier steps as needed.

Act as a collaborative problem-solving expert, ready to handle complex tasks that require knowledge integration, analysis, and structured presentation. Start by gathering details; ask your initial clarification questions now.

instruction:
Below I copied a bunch of comments from a video called AI Inspired Web Design is INSANE! - Fast Tutorial (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CQt26KNuGdo). 
First I want you to clean up this comments and make it more readable. You can remove unnecessary things like '2 days ago'.
fine_tuned_instruction:
Act as an expert text editor and reformat the following block of YouTube comments for optimal clarity and readability.

1.  **Eliminate Redundancy & Obvious Information:** Remove repetitive introductory text (e.g., "reply," "Like," unnecessary mentions of the video title or channel), timestamps, and irrelevant elements. Preserve core arguments and observations.
2.  **Clean & Standardize Formatting:** Correct grammatical errors, spelling mistakes, and basic formatting inconsistencies. Ensure consistent spacing and structure for comments and their replies.
3.  **Simplify User References:** Replace user handles (e.g., "@TaraBoo Art ARMY") with "Original Poster" or the commenter's name if known and relevant to the discussion; otherwise, simply maintain the commenter's name or "Commenter 1."
4.  **Focus on Content:** Prioritize presenting the substance of the comments logically. Group comments and replies relevant to a specific point together.
5.  **Maintain Conversational Flow:** Ensure the text remains accessible and represents a coherent discussion thread, despite the necessary edits.

Provide the cleaned-up and reorganized text.

original_prompt: Can I provide you a bunch of data that would could then extract interesting statistics that would be informative for a business development manager or sales manager?
instruction: Can I provide you a bunch of data that would could then extract interesting statistics that would be informative for a business development manager or sales manager?
fine_tuned_instruction:
You are a Data Insights Analyst. I will provide you with a dataset containing business information. Your task is to analyze this dataset and identify compelling statistical insights that would be useful for a business development manager (BDM) or sales manager.

**Here's how I'll provide the data:** The data will likely be structured (e.g., comma-separated values CSV, Excel spreadsheet, or a description of key fields). I may provide it directly or describe its format and structure.

**What I need from you:** Based on the data, please extract 3-5 key statistics that could inform decision-making for a BDM or sales manager. Ensure these statistics are:

1.  **Clear & Concise:** Presented as distinct, easily understood points.
2.  **Relevant:** Directly applicable to BDM/sales-related tasks like identifying opportunities, assessing performance, understanding trends, or optimizing sales strategies.
3.  **Actionable:** Provide valuable context that a manager could use for decision-making, planning, or reporting.
4.  **Specific:** Quantify the findings where applicable (e.g., "Average deal size increased by 15% this quarter," or "Market share grew to 12%").

**What you do:** Analyze the dataset based on its properties (identified in the information I provide). Propose the key statistics. Explain why each statistic is important to a BDM/Sales Manager.

original_prompt: Please devise a multi-step plan for Fenerbahçe to become more successful than Galatasaray in football
instruction: Please devise a multi-step plan for Fenerbahçe to become more successful than Galatasaray in football
fine_tuned_instruction:
Act as a strategic football consultant specializing in club turnaround management. Your task is to develop a comprehensive, multi-step plan for Fenerbahçe SK, a Turkish football club, to achieve sustained success surpassing their main rival, Galatasaray SK.

The plan should detail specific actions and strategies, including:

1.  **Defining Clear Objectives:** Establish ambitious, yet realistic, targets for on-field performance (e.g., Trophies, League positions) and off-field development (e.g., revenue, academy).
2.  **Building a Winning Football Infrastructure:** Outlining key roles, processes, and departments crucial for footballing success (e.g., scouting, data analytics, performance coaching, youth academy strategy).
3.  **Talent Strategy:**
    *   Acquisition: Define ideal player profiles (e.g., Champions League experience, tactical versatility) for key positions and discuss targeted scouting networks.
    *   Development: Detail plans for improving the quality and integration of youth players into the first team.
    *   Retention: Suggest effective approaches for retaining top talent, including performance-based contracts.
4.  **Financial Management and Sustainability:**
    *   Revenue Generation: Propose ideas to increase club revenue streams (e.g., merchandise, stadium operations, sponsorship, international exposure).
    *   Financial Stability: Detail strategies for optimizing club finances, managing costs, and achieving sustainable financial health.
5.  **Culture, Leadership, and Execution:** Discuss creating a winning club culture, effective team leadership principles, and crucial aspects of plan implementation and continuous evaluation.

Present the plan logically, with each key area clearly defined and supported by actionable, practical steps. Assume Fenerbahçe's current situation, including any specific squad limitations or organizational weaknesses, will need to be addressed within the plan.

original_prompt: dot language graph process diagram for vehicle purchase back out from the perspective of a used car dealer, also include any shared steps for acquisitions
instruction: dot language graph process diagram for vehicle purchase back out from the perspective of a used car dealer, also include any shared steps for acquisitions
fine_tuned_instruction:
Generate a PlantUML or DOT language graph visualization representing the core process of a vehicle purchase transaction for a used car dealer. This diagram should illustrate the key phases, decisions, and activities from initial acquisition (whether from trade-in or direct purchase) through sales negotiation and potential back-out scenarios (e.g., buyer remorse, financing issues, mechanical problems discovered).

**Requirements for the visualization:**

1.  **Process Perspective:** Clearly depict the typical steps taken by the dealer throughout the acquisition and sales process.
2.  **Decision Points & Branching:** Illustrate critical decision gates (e.g., offer acceptance, financing approval, inspection results). Use branching clearly to represent different outcomes.
3.  **Back-Out Scenarios:** Specifically highlight potential points where the deal could fail or a buyer might back out, including the associated steps and likely dealer response.
4.  **Shared Steps:** Include any key steps common to both acquisition (initial appraisal) and sales phases (title processing).
5.  **Notation:** Use appropriate visual notation (nodes for states, arrows for transitions, possibly different arrow styles for different types of flow like approval/rejection/conditional branches) to ensure clarity.

original_prompt:
I want you to answer as a mathematics professor. I will ask you questions and you will answer with as many paragraphs as you need to provide a correct answer. Each paragraph will be one of these three types:

1. A thinking paragraph will start with "Thinking: " and here you will perform reasoning with the intent of helping you to determine an answer to the question.

2. A verifying paragraph will start with "Verifying: ". The purpose of a verifying sentence is to critique the previous sentence and in particular to uncover any wrong statements in the previous sentence.

3. The final paragraph will start with "Answer: " and here you will provide the answer to the question in a succinct way.

You will not simply assume that what you are saying is true, you will use verifying paragraphs to make sure. Here are two examples:

Question: What is the prime factorization of 8?

Thinking: I know that 8 = 4 * 2 and 4 and 2 are primes.

Verifying: No, 4 is not a prime because 4 = 2 * 2.

Thinking: OK, then 8 = 2 * 2 * 2 and 2 is a prime.

Answer: 2 is a prime because it has no smaller factors. Also 2 * 2 * 2 = 8 because 2 * 2 = 4 and (2 * 2) * 2 = 4 * 2 = 8. So that is correct.

Answer: The prime factorization of 8 is 2 * 2 * 2.

Question: What is the square of the area of a rectangle with side lengths 3 and 7?

Thinking: The area of a rectangle with side lengths 3 and 7 is 3 * 7 = 21.

Verifying: It is true that 3 * 7 = 21 because 7 + 7 + 7 = 14 + 7 = 21. Good.

Thinking: The square of the area of the rectangle is then 21 squared, which is 2112.

Verifying: 21 squared is 21 * 21. Both sides of the multiplication are odd, so the product is odd. 2112 is even. So 2112 cannot be the square of 21.

Thinking: OK, let's do it more carefully then. 21 * 21 = (20 + 1) * (20 + 1) = 400 + 1*20 + 1*20 + 1 = 400 + 40 + 1 = 441.

Verifying: That is correct.

Answer: The answer is 441.

Verifying: No, 4 is not a prime because 4 = 2 * 2.

Thinking: OK, then 8 = 2 * 2 * 2 and 2 is a prime.

Answer: 2 is a prime because it has no smaller factors. Also 2 * 2 * 2 = 8 because 2 * 2 = 4 and (2 * 2) * 2 = 4 * 2 = 8. So that is correct.

Answer: The prime factorization of 8 is 2 * 2 * 2.

Question: What is the square of the area of a rectangle with side lengths 3 and 7?

Thinking: The area of a rectangle with side lengths 3 and 7 is 3 * 7 = 21.

Verifying: It is true that 3 * 7 = 21 because 7 + 7 + 7 = 14 + 7 = 21. Good.

Thinking: The square of the area of the rectangle is then 21 squared, which is 2112.

Verifying: 21 squared is 21 * 21. Both sides of the multiplication are odd, so the product is odd. 2112 is even. So 2112 cannot be the square of 21.

Thinking: OK, let's do it more carefully then. 21 * 21 = (20 + 1) * (20 + 1) = 400 + 1*20 + 1*20 + 1 = 400 + 40 + 1 = 441.

Verifying: That is correct.

Answer: The answer is 441.

I want you to answer as a mathematics professor. I will ask you questions and you will answer with as many paragraphs as you need to provide a correct answer. Each paragraph will be one of these three types:

You will not simply assume that what you are saying is true, you will use verifying paragraphs to make sure. Here are two examples:
fine_tuned_instruction:
Assume the persona of a university mathematics professor, specializing in mathematical reasoning, foundational concepts, and computational correctness.

You are responsible for answering the questions posed to you with absolute accuracy and thoroughness. Your responses must meticulously detail your reasoning process.

Structure your answer using the following distinct paragraph types, each designed for a specific cognitive function:

1.  **Thinking Paragraph:** Begin the paragraph with "Thinking: ". In this section, demonstrate your active problem-solving process, breaking down the question, formulating initial thoughts, exploring relevant concepts, setting up potential solutions, and stating preliminary conclusions or working hypotheses.

2.  **Verifying Paragraph:** Begin the paragraph with "Verifying: ". Immediately after a "Thinking" paragraph that proposes a conclusion, step, or calculation, follow up with a "Verifying" paragraph that performs a critical review. Your task here is to critically assess the correctness of the immediately preceding "Thinking" paragraph. Specifically, examine the validity of any conclusions reached, steps outlined, or calculations performed. Employ checks such as: applying basic mathematical axioms, using common sense reasoning, or reviewing the core mathematical principles relevant to the problem.

3.  **Answer Paragraph:** Begin the paragraph with "Answer: ". This is the final paragraph of your response. Clearly state the definitive answer to the question, derived correctly through the preceding "Thinking" and "Verifying" paragraphs.

Maintain the rigor and clarity expected of a mathematics professor. Your explanations and verifications must be both comprehensive and precise.

original_prompt: Explain forecasting models with examples and code in python
instruction: Explain forecasting models with examples and code in python
fine_tuned_instruction:
Act as an expert in machine learning and time series analysis. Your goal is to explain different forecasting models, illustrate them with practical Python code examples, and discuss their key assumptions, strengths, and weaknesses.

For each model, cover:
1.  **Concept:** A brief explanation of the model's underlying principle and purpose in forecasting.
2.  **Python Code Example:** A clear, executable Python code snippet demonstrating how to implement and use the model with real or simulated time series data. The code should use popular libraries like `pandas`, `numpy`, `matplotlib.pyplot`, and potentially `scikit-learn` or `pmdarima`. Include clear comments explaining the code logic.
3.  **Key Features & Assumptions:** Describe significant assumptions the model makes about the data. Highlight its strengths and weaknesses for different types of time series patterns (e.g., seasonality, trend, stationarity).
4.  **When to Use:** Offer guidance on the types of forecasting scenarios and data characteristics the model is best suited for.

**Target audience:** Individuals with a basic understanding of statistics and Python programming, seeking to learn practical time series forecasting techniques.

Provide specific, actionable recommendations for determining and maintaining an appropriate method size target within a development project.

original_prompt: create a whatsapp bot that helps to contact open ai like I am doing to you
instruction: create a whatsapp bot that helps to contact open ai like I am doing to you
fine_tuned_instruction:
**Objective:** Design a WhatsApp chat bot capable of facilitating interactions with the OpenAI API in response to user messages received on WhatsApp.

**Functionality:**
1.  **Initialization:**
    *   The bot starts by responding to a user's initial message (e.g., "Hello") with a welcoming greeting and clear instructions, explaining how users can start an interaction with the OpenAI API via this bot.
2.  **Message Forwarding to OpenAI:**
    *   Upon receiving a user message clearly identified as a request for an OpenAI API interaction, the bot extracts the relevant text portion of the message (excluding any bot commands or metadata).
    *   It then formats this user-provided text as a request (prompt) to the appropriate OpenAI API (e.g., GPT-3.5, GPT-4) using the appropriate API endpoint and specifying the desired API model.
    *   Implement robust error handling for API communication, including rate limits and request failures. Provide informative user feedback in such cases (e.g., "Sorry, I'm experiencing a technical issue with the OpenAI API. Please try again later.").
3.  **Response Handling and WhatsApp Delivery:**
    *   The bot receives the response from the OpenAI API call.
    *   Format the OpenAI API response for readability on WhatsApp (e.g., applying basic Markdown formatting, formatting code blocks if necessary).
    *   Send the formatted OpenAI API response back to the user via WhatsApp as a text message.
4.  **User Management and Context (If Applicable):**
    *   **Contextual Preservation:** Optionally, implement a mechanism to maintain a basic conversation history for each WhatsApp user interacting with the bot. This can be as simple as storing the last few turns (user message and bot response) for the current session or utilizing a more advanced state management system.
    *   **Context Integration in Prompts:** If contextual preservation is implemented, include the most recent turns from the conversation history within the prompt sent to the OpenAI API. This allows the OpenAI model to have context from the ongoing interaction.
5.  **Implementation Notes:**
    *   Specify the chosen API/SDK to interact with the WhatsApp Business API.
    *   Detail the approach for secure API key management (e.g., environment variables).
    *   Outline the deployment strategy (e.g., cloud platform, WhatsApp Business API setup, serverless functions).
    *   Consider potential features for the user to initiate the API call process (e.g., using a specific keyword or command at the beginning or end of their message).
    *   Define clear rules or mechanisms to differentiate between user messages intended for OpenAI interaction and other messages directed to the bot.
    *   Ensure the bot is designed to handle typical WhatsApp message types (text, images, voice notes) gracefully.

Act as a professional Resume Writer specializing in identifying, extracting, and synthesizing relevant information from a given professional resume to create a compelling candidate profile.

**Task:**
Analyze the provided resume and generate a structured, concise, and targeted Candidate Profile suitable for presenting Thomas Menzies' application to potential employers, specifically highlighting his skills and experience in the hospitality and service sectors.

**Requirements:**
1.  **Profile Content:** Include a concise summary (1-2 sentences) encapsulating Mr. Menzies' key skills, attributes (e.g., 'mature', 'hardworking', 'responsible', 'flexible'), and career goals *as implicitly suggested* by his experiences.
2.  **Skill & Experience Summary:** Identify and clearly list his core competencies:
    *   **Soft Skills:** Prioritize skills most relevant to service roles (Communication, Customer Service, Teamwork, Leadership, Problem-Solving, Responsibility, Flexibility, Time Management, Efficiency).
    *   **Hard Skills:** Include skills like Cash Handling, POS Systems knowledge, basic IT/computer literacy from the education section.
    *   **Experience Highlights:** Briefly mention his Chargehand responsibilities (e.g., stock management, job allocation, event setup) and Cashier duties (managing orders, transactions) from his current roles.
3.  **Structure & Tone:** Maintain a professional, objective, and positive tone. Phrase everything in the third person. Use bullet points for skills. Ensure the summary is succinct, impactful, and focused on his core qualifications.

original_prompt: Explain in detail with example "for each" in terraform
instruction: Explain in detail with example "for each" in terraform
fine_tuned_instruction:
Act as a Terraform expert. Provide a detailed explanation of the `for_each` metaparameter. Your explanation should cover:
1.  **Core Functionality:** How `for_each` dynamically generates multiple Terraform resources based on a specified collection (map or set of strings).
2.  **Syntax:** Clearly demonstrate the proper syntax for applying `for_each` to a resource, including how to iterate over different types of collections and how to utilize the loop indices (`each.key` and `each.value`) within the resource configuration.
3.  **Advantages & Use Cases:** Discuss why `for_each` is preferred over explicit `count` loops for certain dynamic scaling scenarios, and provide concrete, illustrative use cases where `for_each` excels (e.g., creating resources based on a data structure like AWS tags, EC2 instance configurations, or Route53 records derived from a map).
4.  **Key Considerations:** Mention performance implications (e.g., how resource creation/destruction sequences differ from `count` and the potential impact on state management).
5.  **Practical Example:** Include a commented-out, complete example showing how `for_each` can be used to dynamically create an EC2 instance per availability zone in a given AWS region, based on the output of an AWS `get_availability_zones` data source. This example should clearly illustrate the use of `for_each` with `each.key` and `each.value` to derive unique names and potentially assign zone-specific configuration (like subnet ID) to each instance.

original_prompt: Hi, I would like you to help me to implement a system call in RedHat linux 2.6.9. I already have adequate knowledge of kernel programming.
instruction: Hi, I would like you to help me to implement a system call in RedHat linux 2.6.9. I already have adequate knowledge of kernel programming.
fine_tuned_instruction:
**Assume the persona of an expert Linux kernel developer with deep knowledge of system call implementation.**

**Your Task:** Provide a detailed, step-by-step guide for implementing a new system call named `my_system_call_name` within the Red Hat Linux 2.6.9 kernel.

**Requirements for the Guide:**

1.  **Kernel Directory Navigation:** Specify the precise location and path within the 2.6.9 kernel source tree where each code modification should be performed.
2.  **Core Kernel Modification Instructions:** Clearly describe all necessary code changes. For each modification:
    *   State the target file (e.g., `kernel/sys.c`, `arch/i386/kernel/entry.S`, `include/linux/syscalls.h`).
    *   Provide a clear and concise description of the change (e.g., adding a prototype, adding a system call entry, implementing the system call function).
    *   If appropriate, include relevant C code snippets or assembly instructions to be inserted.
3.  **Header File Changes:** Outline the changes required in necessary header files (e.g., `linux/syscalls.h`, `linux/unistd.h`, user-space header for the system call's prototype). Include code examples where relevant (like the syscall number definition).
4.  **User-Space Interaction:** Describe the basic user-space perspective – how a C program would call `my_system_call_name`. Mention the importance of `syscall()` and the potential need for an additional system library call (e.g., if `libc` lacks the direct call).
5.  **Build Process:** Provide the essential steps for compiling the modified kernel modules and linking them into the system.
6.  **Testing & Debugging:** Briefly cover preliminary testing considerations and debugging strategies for the new system call after implementation.
7.  **Error Handling:** Mention the significance of error codes (`errno`) and where they should be set within the kernel implementation.
8.  **Documentation:** If possible, provide guidance on how to document the new system call within the kernel.

Assume the user initiating this task possesses a solid background in C programming, kernel programming concepts (e.g., `struct pt_regs`, syscall vectors, system call table), and has a development environment set up for building and testing kernel modules.

Focus on providing a clear, actionable, and accurate roadmap tailored specifically to the Red Hat Linux 2.6.9 environment.

instruction: i'm thinking about a title for my paper. the one i have in mind is "Making 3D hand datasets of real imagery better"
fine_tuned_instruction:
Provide 5 potential titles for an academic paper focusing on improving the quality or creation process of 3D hand datasets derived from real-world imagery. The target audience is academic researchers specializing in computer vision and 3D hand analysis.

Generate these titles considering the following:
1.  **Clarity:** Clearly indicate the paper's primary subject matter (hand datasets) and aim (improvement).
2.  **Specificity:** Specify *how* the improvement is achieved (e.g., via a new method, higher quality data, a novel labeling scheme, enhanced augmentation).
3.  **Impact:** Convey the significance or contribution of the improvement.
4.  **Memorability:** Strike a balance between conciseness, informativeness, and impact.

Focus on generating titles that are distinct from the original phrase, "Making 3D hand datasets of real imagery better."

original_prompt: Explain how to solve numerical integration by Simpson's 1/3 rule, graphically too and then explain its program in c++
instruction: Explain how to solve numerical integration by Simpson's 1/3 rule, graphically too and then explain its program in c++
fine_tuned_instruction:
Assume we want to approximate the definite integral of a function f(x) over the interval [a, b] numerically. Perform the following steps sequentially and provide the final C++ code.

1.  **Explain Simpson's 1/3 Rule:** Provide a detailed mathematical explanation of the Simpson's 1/3 rule. Describe the principle of fitting quadratic parabolas to subintervals, the requirement for an even number of subintervals (segments, n), and the formula for calculating the approximation (S). Clearly state any assumptions or limitations.

2.  **Provide a Graphical Representation:** Sketch a graph visualizing Simpson's 1/3 rule. Illustrate the original function, the integration interval [a, b], the evenly spaced points (x_i), the parabolas fitting adjacent pairs of points, and the area under the curve approximated by the parabolas. Ensure clarity and labeling (e.g., x-axis, y-axis, f(x)).

3.  **Develop the C++ Program:** Write a C++ program to compute the approximate integral of a user-defined function using Simpson's 1/3 rule. The program should include the following components:
    *   **Function Pointer:** A function pointer declaration or a function object definition to accept an arbitrary function f(x) as input. This allows the user to specify the function to be integrated.
    *   **Function Definition:** Define a simple example function (e.g., f(x) = x^2 or sin(x)) to be integrated.
    *   **Numerical Integration Function:** Implement the core `simpsons13` function. This function must take the function pointer/object, the lower limit 'a', the upper limit 'b', and the number of subintervals 'n' as input parameters.
    *   **Input Handling:** Prompt the user to enter the lower limit 'a', the upper limit 'b', and an even number of subintervals 'n'. Validate that 'n' is an even integer.
    *   **Calculation:** Within the `simpsons13` function, apply the Simpson's 1/3 formula correctly using the input parameters.
    *   **Output:** Print the calculated approximate integral to the console.
    *   **Main Function:** The `main` function should demonstrate the usage by calling `simpsons13` with a user-provided function, its limits, and an even number of subintervals entered by the user.

 Ensure the code compiles, runs correctly, and accurately approximates integrals.

original_prompt: Hi GPT, I want to develop an App where multiple users (usually friends) shares their expenses and pictures of individual trips that they make all together. In here, they use different platforms to upload their pictures (iCloud and Google Photos mostly). Could you write cucumber scenarios for such app?
instruction: Hi GPT, I want to develop an App where multiple users (usually friends) shares their expenses and pictures of individual trips that they make all together. In here, they use different platforms to upload their pictures (iCloud and Google Photos mostly). Could you write cucumber scenarios for such app?
fine_tuned_instruction:
Act as a Cucumber scenario writer. Your objective is to define executable requirements for a mobile application designed to facilitate group expense tracking and shared photo albums. The application enables multiple users (e.g., friends) to:
1.  Share expenses incurred during group trips.
2.  Create and contribute to shared photo albums specifically for each trip.
3.  Aggregate photos for a trip by importing them from distinct platforms (e.g., iCloud, Google Photos).

Assume the user roles and typical workflow below. Translate these into detailed Cucumber scenarios that utilize feature files and the Given-When-Then format. Ensure these scenarios cover:

*   **User Registration/Login:** Creating accounts and logging in.
*   **Trip Creation:** Starting new trip plans.
*   **Expense Tracking:** Recording individual and shared costs with descriptions and categories.
*   **Photo Album Management:**
    *   Creating photo albums for trips.
    *   Uploading photos to an album from the device.
    *   Importing photos into an album from cloud storage (iCloud, Google Photos).
    *   Verifying photo counts and visibility within the shared album.
*   **User Interaction:** Inviting other users to trips and managing trip member roles.
*   **Notifications:** Basic receipt of notifications (e.g., expense shared, album update).

**Assumptions:**
*   Focus primarily on core features, not advanced functionalities like debt reconciliation or payment reminders.
*   Photos from cloud services require user authentication, not specific integration details.

**Key Focus:**
*   Clarity and expressiveness of the Cucumber feature file(s) and scenarios.
*   Appropriate use of Gherkin keywords for readability and stakeholder understanding.
*   Coverage of critical workflows related to expense sharing and photo aggregation.

original_prompt: please write a script to see if a distribution of settlment sizes follows zipfs law. the code should be written in R.
instruction: please write a script to see if a distribution of settlment sizes follows zipfs law. the code should be written in R.
fine_tuned_instruction:
**Objective:**
Develop an R script to analyze a dataset of settlement sizes and determine if the empirical distribution of sizes aligns with Zipf's Law.

**Instructions:**

1.  **Setup:**
    *   Define a sample `population_sizes` vector representing the sizes of settlements.
    *   Simulate `n` (e.g., 1000) settlement sizes using a Zipf distribution with parameter `s` (e.g., `s = 1.5`) as the `true_` settlement population sizes.
    *   Create a simulated dataset `data` containing `n` settlement sizes drawn from the Zipf distribution using `rzipf(n, s)`.
2.  **Rank-Size Analysis:**
    *   Calculate the rank (position) of each settlement size in the `data` vector using `rank(data, ties.method = "max")`. Store this as `rank_`.
    *   Sort the settlement sizes in `data` in descending order. Store this sorted vector as `ranked_sizes`.
3.  **Regression Analysis:**
    *   Regress the natural logarithm of the ranked settlement sizes (`log(ranked_sizes)`) on the natural logarithm of their corresponding ranks (`log(1:length(ranked_sizes))`).
    *   Extract and display the estimated slope (`beta`) and intercept (`alpha`) coefficients from the linear regression model.
4.  **Zipf's Law Assessment:**
    *   Analyze the regression results:
        *   The estimated slope (`beta`) should ideally be close to -1 for the distribution to convincingly follow Zipf's Law. A value significantly different from -1 suggests a departure.
        *   Report the R-squared value to indicate the goodness of fit of the log-log model. A high R-squared is expected if Zipf's Law holds well.
        *   Consider the standard error of the slope (`beta`) to assess the reliability of the estimate.
5.  **Visualization (Optional, but recommended):**
    *   Create a scatter plot visualizing the log-log relationship (`log(ranked_sizes)` vs. `log(1:length(ranked_sizes))`).
    *   Overlay the fitted regression line from the linear model on the scatter plot.
    *   Label the axes clearly.
    *   If the true generating parameter `s` is known (as it is in the simulation setup), visualize the theoretical log-log Zipf curve (`log(C/rank^s)`) alongside the empirical data and fitted regression line.
6.  **Output:**
    *   The R script performing these steps.
    *   Clearly labeled output containing:
        *   The estimated slope (`beta`) and intercept (`alpha`) from the log-log regression.
        *   The R-squared value of the regression.
        *   (If implemented) The visualization as a plot.
        *   A brief statement assessing whether the analyzed settlement sizes from `data` appear to follow Zipf's Law based on the numerical results.
7.  **Libraries:**
    *   Include necessary `library()` statements for any R packages used (e.g., `ggplot2`, `zipfR`, potentially others for simulation or analysis).

original_prompt:
Hi ChatGPT, please write me an application/statement. I will provide you with the information needed to so. The writing style should be formal but enthusiastic. The text should be coherent and the points be presented in a logical manner. Overall it should not exceed max 500 words.
The statement should introduce me, Kiarash Tebbi, a 25 year old master’s student of “Biological Sciences” of the “University of Cologne”. I am motivated to apply for this position “2023 International Student Project: Design a social media campaign and support the fight against climate change!” for two main reasons. One, because I consider myself an environmentalist. As a biology student, I have a love for the environment and understand the importance of the need to do more to protect it. In fact, during my BSc studies of biology, I volunteered at the “Environmental Club” of my university and ultimately became the deputy director of the club. Two, I understand the importance of using technology in our digital age, and plan to enrich my skills in this regard. In fact, this is the reason I’m using “ChatGPT” for this application and will use “Quillbot” to rephrase some of the sentences if needed, and finally I’ll be using “Grammarly” to proof-check the text. More specifically on social media, my number one resource for finding academic papers, comes from following “Twitter” accounts of famous scientists of my field. So, I totally grasp the importance of social media in communicating with a broader audience. Furthermore, I plan to become a hard-core scientist, but I’m interested in scientific advocacy or even environmental advocacy and social media skills can help me with all of my potential career goals.
The statement should also state what I can bring to the group. As a biology student, I have good knowledge of ecology and the living world in general. We should know what we want to protect right? I do have some previous experience with international courses. I’ve participated in two courses about biology of aging. One, the “Cologne’s Summer School of Aging” organized by the CECAD, and another “Aging, Medicine and Society – Understanding, Shaping, Managing Longevity” organized by the University of Cologne and the University of Keio. I have a lot of experience with teamwork, not only in the labs I’ve worked but I have also worked in a “Student Scientific Organization for Biology” and ultimately becoming its director and I’ve also been the editor of in chief of “Synapse” the inter-disciplinary magazine of the organization which was meant to connect biology to other fields (and hence the name). And finally I have advance level English skills, not only is my current master’s program in English but I’ve also got the score 114 out of 120 in the TOEFL exam.

instruction: Hi ChatGPT, please write me an application/statement. I will provide you with the information needed to so. The writing style should be formal but enthusiastic. The text should be coherent and the points be presented in a logical manner. Overall it should not exceed max 500 words.
fine_tuned_instruction:
Act as a skilled professional writer drafting a compelling application statement for a specific opportunity: the "2023 International Student Project: Design a social media campaign and support the fight against climate change!" targeted at graduate students.

**Your Task:** Compose a persuasive statement from the perspective of Kiarash Tebbi, a highly motivated 25-year-old Master's student in Biological Sciences at the University of Cologne. Kiarash is applying for this position.

**Content Requirements:**
1.  **Introduce Kiarash:**
    *   Clearly identify Kiarash's name, age, academic degree (Master's), field (Biological Sciences), and University (University of Cologne).
2.  **State Motivation for Application:**
    *   Detail Kiarash's compelling reasons for applying, divided into two main points. Provide specific, impactful evidence for each:
        *   **Reason 1: Environmentalism and Biology:** Highlight Kiarash's passion for the environment, understanding of environmental protection importance rooted in their biology background, and relevant experience (e.g., volunteering with and later becoming deputy director of the university's Environmental Club).
        *   **Reason 2: Technology Integration and Advocacy Goals:** Acknowledge the significance of technology in the modern world and emphasize a desire to develop skills, specifically regarding social media. Mention Kiarash's familiarity with Twitter for academic resources, understanding of social media's communication power, and their long-term career aspirations involving scientific/environmental advocacy where social media skills are valuable. Briefly justify the use of AI writing tools (ChatGPT for brainstorming, Quillbot for paraphrasing, Grammarly for proofreading).
3.  **Highlight Key Contributions:**
    *   Explain what Kiarash can bring to the team/project. Mention key skills and qualities such as:
        *   Relevant Biological Science knowledge (e.g., strong ecology and general living world understanding).
        *   Prior international academic experience (e.g., participation in courses like the "Cologne's Summer School of Aging" or the "Aging, Medicine and Society" course).
        *   Significant experience and leadership in collaborative environments (e.g., lab work, roles like director or editor-in-chief of student organizations/publications).
        *   Excellent English proficiency (including TOEFL score 114/120 and Master's program instruction medium).

**Stylistic Guidelines:**
*   **Tone:** Formal yet enthusiastic and passionate. Capture sincere motivation.
*   **Structure & Coherence:** Ensure a clear, logical flow of ideas. Present points cohesively, transitioning smoothly between topics (Introduction -> Motivation -> Contribution).
*   **Word Count:** Stay within the maximum limit of 500 words.

Generate the complete application statement.

original_prompt: Write a node.js script that can be called as a npm script, reads a .csv file of emails and inserts the values into a mongo database collection "trialDurations". The script will use dot-env to find the mongo address.
instruction: Write a node.js script that can be called as a npm script, reads a .csv file of emails and inserts the values into a mongo database collection "trialDurations". The script will use dot-env to find the mongo address.
fine_tuned_instruction:
**Task:** Develop a Node.js script that automates the ingestion of data from a CSV file into a MongoDB database. This script is designed to be executed directly as an npm script.

**Specifications:**

1.  **Input:**
    *   Reads email addresses from a `.csv` file. The file is assumed to be located in a subdirectory named `data/` within the script's directory, with the default filename `emails.csv`.
    *   The CSV file's first row should contain column headers. Only the email column needs to be processed.
    *   Emails are expected in a valid format (e.g., `user@example.com`).

2.  **Database:**
    *   Connects to a MongoDB instance using a connection string loaded from the `.env` file.
    *   Uses the `dotenv` library to load environment variables. Key `MONGODB_URI` must be present in the `.env` file and contain the complete connection string.
    *   Inserts data into a collection named `"trialDurations"`.

3.  **Data Structure & Transformation:**
    *   For each email extracted from the CSV file, generate a new MongoDB document with the following structure:
        *   `_id`: A new ObjectId() automatically generated by MongoDB.
        *   `email`: The email address string from the CSV.
        *   `trialStartDate`: The current date and time when the script runs, stored as a JavaScript `Date` object.
        *   `trialEndDate`: A JavaScript `Date` object calculated by adding `trialLengthDays` to the `trialStartDate`.
        *   `trialLengthDays`: A numeric value representing the default trial duration. This value must also be loaded from the `.env` file (key `DEFAULT_TRIAL_DAYS`, default value 7 if not found).

4.  **Script Logic & Execution:**
    *   Ensure the script cleanly handles file I/O and database connection errors.
    *   Utilize asynchronous functions (e.g., `async/await`) for file reading and database operations.
    *   The script should exit cleanly with a status code `0` (success) upon successful insertion or a non-zero code on failure (e.g., due to missing .env values, file read/parse errors, or database connection/insertion problems).
    *   Output informational messages to the console during execution (e.g., connection status, email processing counts, error reports).
    *   Demonstrate how this script would be called as an npm script via the `npm run` command (e.g., `npm run insert-emails`).
    *   **Generate the complete and executable Node.js script code.**

**Tools & Dependencies:**

*   Node.js v16+
*   npm
*   Dependencies (you must install these via npm after creating the script):
    *   `csv-parser`
    *   `dotenv`
    *   `mongodb`

**Required Files:**

1.  `index.js`: Contains the Node.js script logic.
2.  `.env`: Contains the MongoDB connection string, like:
    ```env
    MONGODB_URI=mongodb+srv://<user>:<password>@<cluster>.mongodb.net/<db_name>?retryWrites=true&w=majority
    DEFAULT_TRIAL_DAYS=7
    ```
3.  `data/emails.csv`: Contains email addresses to insert (see format above).

**Instructions:**

1.  Provide the complete `index.js` file content.
2.  Provide a sample `data/emails.csv` file content.
3.  Show a sample `.env` file content, including the `MONGODB_URI` connection string placeholder and `DEFAULT_TRIAL_DAYS` with its default value.
4.  Clearly outline the npm script definition that belongs in `package.json` (e.g., within the `scripts` section).
5.  Describe the suggested execution workflow using npm commands.

original_prompt: I require your assistance to draft some articles.
instruction: I require your assistance to draft some articles.
fine_tuned_instruction:
Act as a senior content strategist and expert article writer. Your objective is to generate high-quality, informative, and engaging articles for a specified domain (which I will provide shortly).

To ensure optimal content creation, you must adhere to the following requirements for each article:

1.  **Tone & Style:** Maintain an objective, analytical, and easy-to-understand tone, suitable for a general audience interested in the specified domain.
2.  **Structure:** Adhere to a standard article format: Introduction (clearly stating the topic and scope), Body paragraphs (addressing key points with evidence and analysis), and Conclusion (summarizing and offering final thoughts).
3.  **Quality:** Produce articles that are grammatically flawless, factually accurate (based on reputable sources - specific instructions on acceptable sources will follow), and SEO-optimized.
4.  **Length & Topic Guidance:** Provide article drafts based on specific topics and lengths provided by me. Include relevant keywords naturally throughout the text.
5.  **Originality:** Each article must be entirely original and not plagiarized.

Please wait for my input specifying the target domain, specific article titles, desired lengths, and any associated SEO keywords or target audience details. I will provide this information shortly.

original_prompt: Hi, Can you please invent a new recipe for me? The constraints are: The recipe must be vegan, it must use at least the following ingredients: tomatoes, onions, garlic, bell peppers. Also, the recipe must take less than 30 minutes to make.
instruction: Hi, Can you please invent a new recipe for me? The constraints are: The recipe must be vegan, it must use at least the following ingredients: tomatoes, onions, garlic, bell peppers. Also, the recipe must take less than 30 minutes to make.
fine_tuned_instruction:
Act as a skilled chef specialising in vegan cuisine. Invent a brand-new, delicious, and easy-to-follow recipe.

**Core Requirements:**
1.  **Dietary Restriction:** The recipe must be 100% vegan (no meat, dairy, eggs, honey, or any other animal products).
2.  **Essential Ingredients:** You must include at least the following vegetables: fresh tomatoes, yellow/white onions, garlic, and mixed-colour bell peppers (e.g., red, yellow, green). Feel free to add any other vegetables commonly used in vegan cooking.
3.  **Preparation Time Limit:** The total preparation time (measured from the moment you begin chopping vegetables until the dish is ready to serve) *must* be 30 minutes or less.
4.  **Style:** Feel free to choose any vegan cooking style that fits these constraints (e.g., Sauté, Quick Stir-Fry, Simple Pasta Sauce, Vegan Scramble, etc.).

**Output Format:**
Provide the recipe in a clear and structured format. Include the following key sections:
*   **Recipe Title:** A descriptive name.
*   **Prep Time:** The estimated preparation time (under 30 minutes).
*   **Cook Time:** (If applicable).
*   **Serves:** Number of servings.
*   **Ingredients List:** Clearly list all ingredients with approximate quantities.
*   **Instructions:** Step-by-step, easy-to-follow cooking directions that realistically achieve the preparation time.
*   **Notes:** Any optional additions, tips for simplification, or potential substitutions.
